name: Mizuno
short_description: Michelin Bib Gourmand okonomiyaki restaurant famous for its yam-based 'yamaimo-yaki' which uses no flour.

name: Okonomiyaki Kiji Umeda Sky Building
short_description: A beloved okonomiyaki spot hidden in the basement of the Umeda Sky Building, known for its friendly owner and modan-yaki.

name: Fukutaro Honten
short_description: Popular open-kitchen restaurant specializing in negiyaki (green onion pancakes) and creamy okonomiyaki.

name: Ajinoya Honten
short_description: Bib Gourmand-recognized shop serving fluffy okonomiyaki and savory yakisoba in a bustling location.

name: Chibo Dotonbori
short_description: Famous multi-story okonomiyaki landmark offering a wide variety of teppanyaki dishes and a lively atmosphere.

name: Yukari Sonezaki
short_description: Long-standing okonomiyaki chain known for its unique menu items like the 'Fromage Yaki' with five kinds of cheese.

name: Okaru
short_description: Retro shop famous for its playful mayonnaise art drawn on top of your okonomiyaki by the staff.

name: Takoyaki Wanaka Sennichimae
short_description: Iconic stall next to Namba Grand Kagetsu, serving crispy-outside, creamy-inside takoyaki.

name: Takoyaki Kukuru Dotonbori
short_description: Famous for its large octopus chunks and 'bikkuri' (surprise) takoyaki with octopus sticking out.

name: Kogaryu Takoyaki
short_description: A staple of Amerikamura culture, known for its generous mayonnaise topping and young, hip crowd.

name: Hanadako
short_description: Standing-only counter famous for 'negi-mayo' takoyaki, buried under a mountain of green onions.

name: Abeno Takoyaki Yamachan
short_description: Renowned for its flavorful broth-infused batter that is delicious even without any sauce.

name: Aizuya Namba
short_description: The birthplace of takoyaki, serving small, sauce-less balls that highlight the dashi flavor.

name: Takoyaki Juhachiban
short_description: Unique takoyaki with a crispy texture created by mixing tenkasu (tempura scraps) into the batter.

name: Kushikatsu Daruma Shinsekai
short_description: The most famous kushikatsu chain in Osaka, known for its 'angry chef' mascot and 'no double dipping' rule.

name: Yaekatsu
short_description: Extremely popular kushikatsu spot in the Janjan Yokocho arcade, famous for its light, fluffy batter.

name: Tengu
short_description: Neighbor to Yaekatsu, favored by locals for its doteyaki (miso-simmered beef sinew) and crispy skewers.

name: Kushikatsu Shichifukujin
short_description: Friendly, counter-only spot in the Tenma drinking district offering affordable and delicious kushikatsu.

name: Kinryu Ramen
short_description: Iconic 24-hour ramen stand with a giant dragon sign, serving mild tonkotsu broth with unlimited kimchi.

name: Kamukura Ramen Dotonbori
short_description: Famous for its 'Oishii Ramen' featuring a sweet, vegetable-heavy broth that differs from typical tonkotsu.

name: Jinrui Minna Menrui
short_description: Legendary ramen shop with long queues, famous for its thick soy sauce broth and massive chashu pork blocks.

name: Moeyo Mensuke
short_description: Stylish ramen bar specializing in duck (kamo) broth and shellfish ramen with elegant toppings.

name: Ramen Yashichi
short_description: Top-tier creamy chicken soy sauce ramen shop; ticket system usually requires arriving early.

name: Hanamaruken Ramen
short_description: Famous for its 'Happiness Ramen' featuring a slow-cooked pork rib cartilage that melts in your mouth.

name: Zundo-ya Shinsaibashi
short_description: Popular Himeji-style tonkotsu ramen chain, open 24 hours and perfect for a late-night meal.

name: Endo Sushi Central Market
short_description: Historic sushi shop located inside the wholesale market, famous for its warm rice 'tsukami-zushi'.

name: Harukoma Sushi
short_description: Bustling sushi joint in the Tenjinbashisuji arcade offering generous cuts of fresh fish at budget prices.

name: Genrokuzushi Dotonbori
short_description: The birthplace of kaiten (conveyor belt) sushi, marked by a giant hand holding sushi on the sign.

name: Daiki Suisan Dotonbori
short_description: Large conveyor belt sushi restaurant popular for its wide variety of fresh seafood direct from the port.

name: Kamenozushi Main Store
short_description: Classic, multi-story sushi restaurant near Umeda offering high-quality nigiri in a lively, traditional setting.

name: Usamitei Matsubaya
short_description: The inventor of Kitsune Udon (udon with sweet fried tofu), serving the original comforting bowl since 1893.

name: Tsurutontan Soemoncho
short_description: Famous for massive bowls of udon noodles with creative broths ranging from cream sauce to spicy roe.

name: Dotonbori Imai
short_description: A tranquil traditional oasis amidst the neon, renowned for its refined dashi broth and kitsune udon.

name: Matsusakagyu Yakiniku M Hozenji Yokocho
short_description: Upscale yakiniku spot located in a historic alley, specializing in premium Matsusaka beef.

name: Yakiniku Sora Tsuruhashi
short_description: Authentic, smoky Korean BBQ joint in Osaka's Korea Town, famous for its horumon (offal) and lively vibe.

name: Kitamura
short_description: Michelin-starred Kansai-style sukiyaki establishment dating back to 1881, offering a luxurious beef experience.

name: Hariju Dotonbori
short_description: Historic beef specialist serving sukiyaki and shabu-shabu in a traditional Japanese building since 1919.

name: Hokkyokusei Shinsaibashi
short_description: The birthplace of Omurice (omelet rice), serving the classic dish in a beautiful traditional courtyard setting.

name: Jiyuken Namba
short_description: Founded in 1910, famous for its unique 'Meibutsu Curry' where rice and curry are mixed together with a raw egg on top.

name: 551 Horai Honten
short_description: Osaka's soul food; a Chinese restaurant famous for its 'butaman' (steamed pork buns) which are a must-buy souvenir.

name: Rikuro Ojisan Namba
short_description: Famous bakery known for its jiggly, freshly baked cheesecakes that are rung in with a bell.

name: Kani Douraku Dotonbori
short_description: Landmark crab restaurant famous for its moving mechanical crab sign and multi-course crab kaiseki feasts.

name: Kuromon Ichiba Market
short_description: Known as 'Osaka's Kitchen', this market is packed with stalls selling fresh seafood, grilled skewers, and fruits.

name: Maguroya Kurogin
short_description: Highly rated tuna specialist in Kuromon Market offering melt-in-your-mouth otoro bowls and sashimi.

name: Wad Omotenashi Cafe
short_description: Serene Japanese cafe offering traditional tea ceremonies, matcha, and artisanal shaved ice (kakigori).

name: Lilo Coffee Roasters
short_description: Micro-roastery offering a vast selection of single-origin beans and varied brewing methods in a hip space.

name: Fujiya 1935
short_description: Three-Michelin-starred restaurant serving innovative Spanish-influenced cuisine using Japanese seasonal ingredients.

name: Hajime
short_description: World-renowned 3-Michelin-star restaurant offering a conceptual and artistic French-Japanese tasting menu.

name: Osaka Ohsho Dotonbori
short_description: The headquarters of the famous gyoza chain, known for its giant signboard and reliable dumplings.

name: Izakaya Toyo
short_description: Famous standing izakaya featured on Netflix, where the charismatic chef cooks tuna with a blowtorch by hand.
